ygData.subject: Re: magic only creatures - my solution and question
ygData.msgSnippet: A lot of the higher level undead can only be hit by magic weapons.  Don t go to Befallen or Unrest without one.  The ice boned and dry boned skeletons can only
ygData.messageBody:
A lot of the higher level undead can only be hit by magic weapons. Don't go
to Befallen or Unrest without one. The ice boned and dry boned skeletons
can only be hit by magic and are nasty enough to be a tough fight even with
a magic weapon. I wouldn't want to go against one of those guys without
anything but my hardest hitting weapon. I think I started seeing a lot of
them around level 16 or so.

By the way, I never even bought the weapon summoning spells because I had my
combine by then, could never keep my 1-H blunt trained up, and would do more
damage with my magic sword anyway. I have not missed those spells. I
always have backup weapons in the bank for when I die and lately (level 20)
often have a magic backup weapon tucked away.


>From: Gary Long <glong@...>
>Reply-To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
>To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqpaladin] magic only creatures - my solution and question
>Date: Fri, 11 Jun 1999 09:31:22 -0700
>
>From: Gary Long <glong@...>
>
>I use a minotaur axe/targ shield combo 99% of the time, but should I need
>to
>attack or defend against a creature only hit by magic weapons then I haul
>out
>my trusty staff or dagger (fang?) summoned by a friendly magician and
>commence
>wacking the baddie. It would be nice to have the combine longsword or some
>other decent magical weapon, but I'm still about 50 platinum short, what
>with
>having to buy armor, arrows, etc.
>
>The staff is nice - dmg 8, delay 40? - and my skill is going steadily up in
>2H
>blunt. The summoned dagger is decent as well (dmg 4, delay 21?) but
>doesn't do
>nearly enough damage when hunting wisps or scarecrows. I'm also working on
>pushing 1H blunt up for when I can summon the mace in four levels. If I
>*really* want to, I could go punish bandits with a wizard friend in the
>karanas
>and have that combine longsword in a week. The thing is, I don't usually
>hunt
>for creatures hit by magic only because there's so many critters running
>round
>that don't have that limitation!
>
>So here's a question for you higher-level paladins (16th and over) - at
>what
>level does it become necessary to have a magic weapon, and can the
>situations
>that require a magic weapon be handled by our summoned mace?
>
>Kaladin, the curious 11th level Paladin
>
